st-abbs-head.title: St Abb's Head
st-abbs-head.description: St. Abb's Head is a rocky promontory at the village of St. Abbs, Berwickshire, Scottish Borders, and a national nature reserve administered by the National Trust of Scotland.

ben-lomond.title: Ben Lomond
ben-lomond.description: Ben Lomond, 974 metres (3,196 ft), is a distinctive mountain in the Scottish Highlands. Situated on the eastern shore of Loch Lomond, it is the most southerly of the Munros.

culzean-castle-country-park.title: Culzean Castle & Country Park
culzean-castle-country-park.description: Culzean Castle is a castle near Maybole, Carrick, on the Ayrshire coast of Scotland. It is the former home of the Marquess of Ailsa, the chief of Clan Kennedy, but is now owned by the National Trust for Scotland. The clifftop castle lies within the Culzean Castle Country Park and is opened to the public.

staffa.title: Staffa
staffa.description: Staffa from the Old Norse for stave or pillar island, is an island of the Inner Hebrides in Argyll and Bute, Scotland. The Vikings gave it this name as its columnar basalt reminded them of their houses, which were built from vertically placed tree-logs.

staffa-boat-trip.title: Staffa - Boat Trip
staffa-boat-trip.description: Staffa from the Old Norse for stave or pillar island, is an island of the Inner Hebrides in Argyll and Bute, Scotland.

coire-gabhail.title: Coire Gabhail
coire-gabhail.description: Coire Gabhail is a high level glen in the Bidean nam Bian mountain massif to the south of Glen Coe, Highland, Scotland. Its narrow entrance 230 metres (750 ft) up the hillside conceals the width of the glen beyond, and it is commonly known as the Hidden Valley or Lost Valley of Glencoe.

kintail.title: Kintail
kintail.description: Kintail is an area of mountains in the Northwest Highlands of Scotland. It is located in the Highland Council area.

iona.title: Iona
iona.description: Iona is a small island in the Inner Hebrides off the Ross of Mull on the western coast of Scotland. It was a centre of Gaelic monasticism for four centuries and is today renowned for its tranquility and natural beauty.

buachaille-etive-beag.title: Buachaille Etive Beag
buachaille-etive-beag.description: Buachaille Etive Beag is a mountain located between Glen Coe and Glen Etive, on the edge of Rannoch Moor in the Scottish Highlands.

falls-of-glomach.title: Falls of Glomach
falls-of-glomach.description: The Falls of Glomach, in Ross-shire, Scotland, is one of the highest waterfalls in Britain, at 113 m (370 ft).

inverewe-garden.title: Inverewe Garden
inverewe-garden.description: Inverewe Garden is a botanical garden in the Scottish Highlands. It is located just to the north of Poolewe in Wester Ross, and is noted for the breadth of its collection.

corrieshalloch-gorge.title: Corrieshalloch Gorge
corrieshalloch-gorge.description: Corrieshalloch Gorge is situated on the Droma River 20 km S of Ullapool in the Scottish Highlands. It is 1.5 km long, 60m deep and formed at the end of the last ice age by rapid erosion caused by meltwater.

linn-of-tummel.title: Linn of Tummel
linn-of-tummel.description: Linn of Tummel is a 19-hectare (47-acre) woodland property at the confluence of the rivers Garry and Tummel, near Pitlochry in Perthshire, Scotland.
